glsa.title: Supervisor: command injection vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in Supervisor might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: Supervisor is a client/server system that allows its users to monitor and control a number of processes on UNIX-like operating systems.

description.p: A vulnerability in Supervisor was discovered in which an authenticated client could send malicious XML-RPC requests and supervidord will run them as shell commands with process privileges. In some cases, supervisord is configured with root permissions.

impact.p: A remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Supervisor users should upgrade to the latest version:
